intro: Raphanus laevigatus, commonly known as the smooth radish, is a root vegetable belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its round, smooth, white or pale yellow root that is typically harvested when young and tender. The plant grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with pinnately lobed leaves that are edible. Its flowering stems produce small, yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees. The plant prefers cool climates and well-drained soil, making it a popular crop in temperate regions.
